snippet: As Spain prepares to crown a new king, it seems incredible that a dozen monarchies still survive across Europe.
abstract: Serge Schmemann Editorial Notebook contends that abdication of King Juan Carlos of Spain raises question of why so many monarchs still reign in Europe; maintains that European monarchs still serve as unifying symbols, and represent their nations' history and continuity.
lead_paragraph: As Spain prepares to crown a new king, it seems incredible that a dozen monarchies still survive across Europe.
